citeinfo.title: KARST_SPRINGS_MM65_IN: Springs in South-Central Indiana (Indiana Geological Survey, 1:126,720, Point Shapefile)
citeinfo.othercit: A predecessor coverage, named SPG, was used in the publication of the following map: Powell, R. L., Frushour, S. S., and Harper, D., 1997, Areas of sinkhole and sinking-stream basins, with cave locations and springs, in south-central Indiana, Indiana Geological Survey Miscellaneous Map 65.

descript.abstract: KARST_SPRINGS_MM65_IN is a point shapefile that shows the locations of springs in and around the karst region of south-central Indiana.
descript.purpose: KARST_SPRINGS_MM65_IN was derived from a coverage named SPG. The purpose of SPG was to compile a map layer showing springs in southern Indiana, in and around the karst area, using unpublished work maps of Richard L. Powell, a former employee of the Indiana Geological Survey (IGS), and unpublished data from a spreadsheet provided by Samuel S. Frushour (IGS), and to bring that map layer to publication by the IGS.

idinfo.native: ArcView version 3.2 shapefile format, approximately 36 Kb

attracc.attraccr: The shapefile was reviewed in ESRI ArcView by four IGS personnel, who determined that no internal attributes are present.

dataqual.complete: According to a rough estimate by Samuel S. Frushour, the predecessor coverage, named SPG, may include approximately 50 percent of perennial and semi-perennial springs in the area that is centered around the karst region of south-central Indiana.

horizpa.horizpar: No quantitative tests were performed to measure horizontal positional accuracy.

vertacc.vertaccr: The vertical positional accuracy was not a factor in the production of KARST_SPRINGS_MM65_IN.

citeinfo.title: Springs in South-Central Indiana
citeinfo.othercit: Compiled from unpublished work maps of Richard L. Powell (formerly of the Indiana Geological Survey, IGS) and an unpublished spreadsheet provided by Samuel S. Frushour (IGS).

srcinfo.srccontr: Unpublished work maps showed plotted locations of springs. The spreadsheet provided locations of springs in the Congressional Land Survey System (Township-Range-Section) format.

procstep.procdesc: After paper maps were received from Richard L. Powell (formerly of the Indiana Geological Survey), personnel of the IGS scanned, digitized, and georeferenced a coverage. After a spreadsheet was received from Sam Frushour (IGS), coordinate information was converted from Congressional Land Survey System to UTM Zone 16, NAD 27 by Charles W. Zuppann (IGS), using Geographix software, and a point coverage was created. The points from the two sources were plotted on paper and reviewed by Powell and Frushour for accuracy. Some points were moved or eliminated because of duplications or mislocations, and a final combined coverage, named SPG, was produced.

The original coverage, SPG, was reprojected using UTM Zone 16, NAD83. This coverage was then clipped to another coverage named INCLP83, a boundary coverage for the State of Indiana (compiled at a scale of 1:24,000). The resulting shapefile was named KARST_SPRINGS_MM65_IN.

This metadata was pre-parsed and parsed using CNS (Chew and Spit,v 2.6.1) and MP (Metadata Parser, v 2.7.1) software written by Peter N. Schweitzer (United States Geological Survey). The errors generated by MP were all addressed and corrected, except that no values were assigned to "Abscissa_Resolution" and "Ordinate_Resolution."

metainfo.metuc: This metadata file is intended to accompany the data set identified and received from the IGS. It should not to be altered or summarized. IGS does not support secondary distribution. If this data set was received from anyone besides the IGS, this metadata file and the data set it describes may lack integrity.
